snippet: Burundi has been rocked by protests because of President Pierre Nkurunziza’s push for a third term in office in elections set for next Wednesday.
abstract: Provisional results from parliamentary election in Burundi, boycotted by most opposition groups, show governing party winning 77 of 100 seats, giving majority to National Council for the Defense of Democracy-Forces for the Defense of Democracy.
lead_paragraph: Burundi has been rocked by protests because of President Pierre Nkurunziza’s push for a third term in office in elections set for next Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: Africa; Burundi: Victory for Governing Party
